page.title: 01Halstead Kent
page.content: {Halstead, Kent,}a small village of approximately two thousand inhabitants,{expanded about 100 years {ago}when fruit growing increased in the area. It is not a picturesque village but is a{friendly and pleasant place to live. The buildings are a mixture of old and modern;{flint cottages,}some {weatherboard houses}and a variety of more recent styles. One of several large houses is{Halstead Hall,}the childhood home of E.Nesbit the writer. Social and sporting activities focus around the{village hall, St Margarets {Church, Halstead County Primary {School,}and the{recreation ground. The accessibility of the village to Knockholt Station makes it popular with{commuters.}The majority of residents work outside the village in nearby towns or at{Fort Halstead.
